review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Give yourself credit for your effort to notice your pattern around the balance of your
        stress response with recovery. The Path is a place of physical, emotional, and mental balance.

step_of_the_day.title:
Step of the Day:
        Leading with your thoughts; noticing your thinking pattern (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
â€œHalf this game is ninety percent mental\" Yogi Berra, the famous N.Y. Yankee baseball player who was a unique
        thinker.Your thoughts are powerful. Thoughts activate your brain. Thoughts literally change your brain by causing the
        growth of connections between neurons. This development in the brain then strengthens those very thoughts that
        create the change. This is the basis of learning and even habit formation.Once learning takes place, new thinking tends to follow those pathways and thus keeps strengthening them. It
        takes awareness and intention to begin establishing new patterns.

action_step:
Pay attention to the tendencies in your thinking. Do you first go to what can go wrong, or what can go right? Do
        your interpretations tend to be negative or positive? When you notice a habit pattern, do you consider the
        possibility of making a change to that pattern? Notice any anxiety as well as worry that is attached to the
        anxiety.
journal_entry: Write about your belief about your ability to change your pattern
